item.title: Report X-2024051143
item.description:
Report X-2024051143

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: PARSIPPANY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING COOKIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS UNREGULATED ICE-BRIX GEL PACKS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM NEW JERSEY USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 74E3E3, DAVID'S COOKIES, 11 CLIFFSIDE DR, CEDAR GROVE NJ 07009-1234.

item.title: Report E-2024050720
item.description:
Report E-2024050720

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: PORT READING
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 8, 2024 at 1800 Mechanical personnel in the Conrail Port Reading Yard discovered , HSRX 3130 a loaded tank car of Petroleum Distillates (Isomerate) leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Kinder Morgan was notified directly via phone . Conrail Manager of Hazardous Material, Joe Caccamo along with Marion Environmental personnel, investigated the leak and found the source be from the reclosing pressure relief device. Liquid product was escaping from the PRD indicating an overloaded condition. The magnetic gauging device was completely maxed out and showing no vapor space in the tank car. A vacuum truck was used to safely remove approximately 3500 gallons. Cause Code: 419 5 x ( 5 + 5 + 0 ) x ( 2+ 0 ) = 100

item.title: Report X-2024051688
item.description:
Report X-2024051688

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: LAWNSIDE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED AND SORTED AND ENDED UP IN SMALL SORT ARB. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE HAD SLIGHT FUMES. THE PACKAGE WAS RETRIEVED AND RETURNED TO QC WHERE THE DAMAGE WAS DISCOVERED. THE LEAKING CONTENTS WERE SOLIDIFIED AND BAGGED.

item.title: Report X-2024051577
item.description:
Report X-2024051577

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING UNLOADING MANAGER NOTICED PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. I THEN SECURED IT AND VENTILATED THE PACKAGE SAFELY AND PROPERLY. I REPACKED THE 1 DAMAGED BOTTLE INTO ITS OWN DRUM AND THE OTHER 3 WERE REPACKED INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SEPERATELY. APPROXIMATELY 1 OUNCE LEAKED FROM 1 OF THE 4 BOTTLES DUE TO A HOLE IN THE LID/CAP. AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW.
